title: How to Find Friends' Birthdays on Facebook for iPhone & iPad

steps.title: Open the Facebook app on your iPhone or iPad.
steps.content: Open the Facebook app on your iPhone or iPad. The Facebook icon looks like a white "f" in a blue square. You can find it on your Home screen or in your App Library.

steps.title: Tap the magnifying glass.
steps.content: Tap the magnifying glass. It's in the upper-right area of the screen. This opens the Search bar.

steps.title: Type birthdays.
steps.content: Type birthdays . After you type the first several letters, you'll see "Birthdays" with a green-and-white cake icon appear at the top of the search results.

steps.title: Tap Birthdays in the search results.
steps.content: Tap Birthdays in the search results. This displays current, belated, recent, and upcoming birthdays on the same screen.

steps.title: Open the Facebook app on your iPhone or iPad.
steps.content: Open the Facebook app on your iPhone or iPad. The Facebook icon looks like a white "f" in a blue square. You can find it on your Home screen or in your App Library. If you find yourself forgetting your friends' birthdays, you can customize birthday notifications on Facebook.

steps.title: Tap the three-line menu ☰.
steps.content: Tap the three-line menu ☰ . It's at the bottom-right corner of Facebook.

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Settings & Privacy.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Settings & Privacy . Additional options will expand.

steps.title: Tap Settings.
steps.content: Tap Settings . You'll see this just below "Settings & Privacy."

steps.title: Tap Notifications.
steps.content: Tap Notifications . It's under the "Preferences" heading.

steps.title: Tap Birthdays.
steps.content: Tap Birthdays . A list of options for receiving birthday notifications will appear.

steps.title: Toggle the "Allow Notifications on Facebook" switch to the On position .
steps.content: Toggle the "Allow Notifications on Facebook" switch to the On position . When the switch is blue, you'll receive notifications on Facebook for upcoming and/or belated birthdays. [2] X Research source If this switch is already on (blue), there is no need to make any changes.

steps.title: Select where you want to receive notifications.
steps.content: Select where you want to receive notifications. In the "Where you receive these notifications" section, you can enable Push notifications (the kind that pop up in Facebook your iPhone or iPad), email notifications, and/or SMS text notifications from Facebook.
